DataElement.preferredName: During Collection Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Combined Anticoagulant Agent Administration Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not anticoagulants were added to the hematopoietic cell graft during collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: During Collection Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Combined Anticoagulant Agent Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: At some point in a given period of time._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)._Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more._A drug that helps prevent blood clots from forming. Also called a blood thinner._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredName: During Collection Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: At some point in a given period of time.:The act of gathering something together.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: At some point in a given period of time.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more.:Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more.
Any agent capable of preventing blood clot formation.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.
